title: Revert is slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: When I answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog and double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it, the file is opened quickly. However, if I repeat the previous steps and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
OB:
1. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
2. Double click on the file in the navigator.
3. Repeat steps 1 and 2.
4. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
EB: When selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, the file contents should be replaced quickly, similar to when closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1. Open a file in the java editor.
2. Make changes to the file.
3. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
4. Double click on the file in the navigator.
5. Note the time it takes for the file to be reopened.
6. Repeat steps 3-5 and select 'Close' instead of 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
7. Compare the time it takes for the file to be reopened when using 'Revert' versus 'Close' and provide the difference.
